presentation.title: About Me
aboutMe: I’m Jesús Alejandro Gómez Salazar, a student passionate about applied and theoretical sciences, sports, logical development, and communication skills. I am currently studying a Higher Vocational Training program (FPGS) in Web Application Development, working with Java and Spring, with a specialization in Spring Data JPA and React. I am actively seeking new job opportunities where I can continue growing professionally and apply my knowledge with commitment and responsibility.

Throughout my academic path, I have been recognized several times for my achievements, participating in municipal and regional competitions. One of the most meaningful experiences of my student life has been my active involvement in a debate club, where I developed advanced communication and public speaking skills—abilities that earned me multiple awards and certificates. These experiences strengthened not only my communication abilities but also my confidence and leadership.

webDev.title: FPGS - Web Application Development
content: Equivalent to an Advanced Vocational Training program focused on developing web applications using Java, Spring, and React.

baccalaureate.title: High School - Mixed Health Sciences
content: High school studies combining Mathematics II, Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and Applied Anatomy.

responsibilities: During my dual training internship, I participated in development projects using Spring Boot, where I learned to configure applications, work with controllers and services, and connect the backend to databases using Spring Data JPA. I also got involved in creating REST endpoints and understanding the structure of a real-world project.
eviden.skills: This experience allowed me to build a solid foundation in Spring Boot, improve my programming logic, and become familiar with the development lifecycle in professional environments.
